meanings.definition: A member of the Knights Templar, a medieval Christian military order.
meanings.sent1: The templar rode his horse bravely into battle.
meanings.sent2: The historical novel featured a brave templar fighting for his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The templar accidentally put on his armor backward and couldn't move.
meanings.sent4: She was a templar of justice, always fighting for what was right.
meanings.sent5: The templar's armor gleamed in the sunlight as he prepared for combat.

meanings.definition: A person who is dedicated to a cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: The young girl was a templar of kindness, always helping others in need.
meanings.sent2: He was a templar of environmental conservation, working tirelessly to protect nature.
meanings.sent3: The templar of fashion always wore the latest trends with confidence.
meanings.sent4: She was a templar of love, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The templar of knowledge eagerly shared his wisdom with anyone willing to listen.
